title: Brussels tram route 51
text:
The tram route 51 in <a href="Brussels">Brussels</a>, <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a> is a tram route operated by the <a href="Brussels%20Intercommunal%20Transport%20Company">STIB/MIVB</a>, which connects the <a href="Heysel/Heizel%20metro%20station">Heysel metro station</a> in the <a href="City%20of%20Brussels">City of Brussels</a> to the Van Haelen stop in the municipality of <a href="Uccle">Uccle</a>. The route runs North-South, crossing the municipalities of the City of Brussels, <a href="Jette">Jette</a>, <a href="Molenbeek-Saint-Jean">Molenbeek-Saint-Jean</a>, the City of Brussels again, <a href="Saint-Gilles%2C%20Belgium">Saint-Gilles</a>, <a href="Forest%2C%20Belgium">Forest</a> and Uccle.
Starting from the Heysel metro station the route runs along the <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%2023">tram route 23</a> on a proper route parallel to the "Boulevard du Centenaire/Eeuwfeestlaan" up to the "Centenaire/Eeuwfeest" stop. At this point the route 23 turns left and the route 51 turns right, joining the <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%2019">tram route 19</a> on the "Avenue Jean Sobieski/Jan Sobieskilaan". The route then follows the "Boulevard de Smet de Naeyer/De Smet de Naeyerlaan", connecting with the <a href="Brussels%20Metro">Brussels Metro</a> again at the <a href="Stuyvenbergh%20metro%20station">Stuyvenbergh metro station</a>. Past the <a href="Jette%20cemetery">Jette cemetery</a>, the routes 19 and 51 separate, with the route 51 heading towards the <a href="Belgica%20metro%20station">Belgica metro station</a> via the "Avenue Charles Woeste/Charles Woestelaan", and then toward the <a href="Ribaucourt%20metro%20station">Ribaucourt metro station</a> via the "Boulevard Belgica/Belgicalaan" and the "Boulevard du Jubilé/Jubelfeestlaan". At the Ribaucourt metro station the route joins the <a href="small%20ring%20%28Brussels%29">small ring road</a> at the "Place Sainctelette/Saincteletteplein" via the "Boulevard Léopold II/Leopold II Laan", crosses the <a href="Brussels%E2%80%93Scheldt%20Maritime%20Canal">Brussels–Scheldt Maritime Canal</a>, connects with the metro at the <a href="Yser/IJzer%20metro%20station">Yser metro station</a>, enters the city center of the <a href="City%20of%20Brussels">City of Brussels</a>, then runs along the canal up to the <a href="Ninove%20gate">Ninove gate</a>. At this point, the route 51 joins the <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%2082">tram route 82</a>, running along the small ring road up to the <a href="Brussels-South%20railway%20station">Brussels-South railway station</a> via the <a href="Lemonnier%20premetro%20station">Lemonnier premetro station</a>. At this latter metro station, the route enters the tunnel known as the <a href="North%E2%80%93South%20Axis%20%28Brussels%29">North–South Axis</a>, up to the <a href="Albert%20premetro%20station">Albert premetro station</a>. These stops from Lemonnier to Albert connect with tram routes <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%203">3</a> and <a href="Brussels%20tram%20route%204">4</a>. When exiting the tunnel, the route 51 heads towards the "Place de l'Altitude Cent", then joins the "Chaussée d'Alsemberg/Alsembergsesteenweg" up to the <a href="Uccle-Calevoet%20railway%20station">Uccle-Calevoet railway station</a>, then joins again the "Chaussée d'Alsemberg" via the "Rue Engeland/Engelandstraat" and the "Rue du Château d'Or/Gulden Kasteelstraat". It then stops at the Van Haelen stop on the "Chaussée d'Alsemberg" at the border between the <a href="Brussels-Capital%20Region">Brussels-Capital Region</a> and the <a href="Flanders">Flemish</a> municipality of <a href="Linkebeek">Linkebeek</a>.
